intro: Tubella quitensis, commonly known as the Andean tuber, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots that store nutrients. The plant features showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tubella quitensis is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
